definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: As dusk descends on the mountains, a pangolin emerges from its burrow.
sentences.chinese: 当薄暮涌入山区，一只穿山甲从地洞钻了出来。

sentences.english: The enemy must've been using it to dig their tu els.
sentences.chinese: 敌人一定是用生化战场激活码他来挖地洞。

sentences.english: To dwell in the cliffs of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 以致他们住在荒谷之间，在地洞和岩穴中。

sentences.english: Golden- mantled ground squirrels live in underground burrows, where they store their food.
sentences.chinese: 金毛松鼠住在地洞中，它们在地洞中存放食物。

sentences.english: Golden- mantled ground squirrels live in underground burrows, where they store their food.
sentences.chinese: 金毛松鼠住在地洞中，它们在地洞中存放食物。

sentences.english: The NATO player is advised to utilize the terrain and engineer units to dig in.
sentences.chinese: 给北约玩家的劝告是使用地形与工兵单位去挖地洞。

sentences.english: CHECK IT OUTI can't tell a diamond from a hole in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 检查出来我不能告诉从一个地洞里的钻石。

sentences.english: Moulting usually takes place in the protected moist environment of their burrows.
sentences.chinese: 它们总是选择安全且潮湿的地洞来完成脱壳。

sentences.english: Caves and tunnels have always been part of human life.
sentences.chinese: 地洞和隧道已经成为了人类生活的一部分。

sentences.english: That’s why his mother had abandoned this cave under the Lorelei.
sentences.chinese: 这就是他妈妈离开这个罗雷莱地洞的原因。

sentences.english: Madam's facial expression of that Liu's mansion heaves red, quite anxious to seek a ground aperture to drill into.
sentences.chinese: 那刘府的夫人脸色涨红，恨不得找个地洞钻进去。

sentences.english: Bellick dug the hole in the guard room.
sentences.chinese: 贝里克挖开了警卫室的那个地洞。

sentences.english: Selonians live together in genetically related dens in underground burrows.
sentences.chinese: 塞洛尼亚人居住在基因上相关的地洞巢穴里。

sentences.english: The rabbits burrowed into our lawn.
sentences.chinese: 兔子掘地洞一直钻到我们草坪上。

sentences.english: Our new habitation was an excavation made in the earth.
sentences.chinese: 我们的新住所是一处挖空的地洞。

sentences.english: Some solitary bees make their nests in burrows in the soil.
sentences.chinese: 一些独居蜂会把巢筑在田间的地洞里。

definition: Dongkou county in Shaoyang 邵陽|邵阳[Shao4 yang2], Hunan
to conceal oneself/to go into hiding/to take cover
a room for keeping sth hidden/secret room/hidden chamber
